intro: Hieracium cymosum subsp. praealtum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. This subspecies is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
